text: Ganz kleine Nachtmusik (German for "Very little night music"), K. 648, is a trio for string instruments by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart. The piece was written when Mozart was a young teenager. A copy of it was found in Carl Ferdinand Becker's collection in Leipzig. It was announced to be found in September 2024. It was played for the first time on 21 September at the Leipzig Opera by Vincent and David Geer (violins) and Elisabeth Zimmermann (cello) == References == Category:Compositions by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart Category:Compositions in C major
title: Ganz kleine Nachtmusik
